title: Messages deleted/missing after compacting
content:
First off, I'd like to thank Wayne Mery and david for their responses to my query - it's pretty awesome that folks even bother to help these days, and I'm grateful.

To answer Wayne's query, all my folders, sub-folders, and sub-sub-folders are intact - just simply zero saved e-mails in any of them (I did check each one).

david - your info was most helpful, as I once was pretty confident in my Windows 'skillset', but I switched to Linux over 20 years ago, so the process will be a bit different - am working on that, and hoping some of the Endeavor OS forums can help me translate your directions.

I'm convinced these e-mails still exist somewhere in the 'ether', so there must be a way to retrieve them and restore them (after which - lesson learned - I will move them to files on my main backup drives).

While the problem isn't solved, I really want to thank you both again for coming to my aid - it is truly most appreciated! John Van Epps (JVE)
creator: johnvanepps0312

title: upgrade to Thunderbird Release failed to "port" two of five email accounts
content: Upon following the instructions to upgrade from the ESR version to the Thunderbird version, I am left with two email accounts that are devoid of messages. Additionally, tabs at the top now have no title or content. Recommendations?
creator: incredibill

title: Download attachment filenames
content:
Thunderbird 128.11.0 ESR 64 bit on Windows 10 PC

When I take pics on my Droid phone and e-mail them as attachments using Yahoo! e-mail on my phone to my Thunderbird account on my PC I use at home, the filenames change.

They used to show up with the filenames as 'date stamps', ie 20250527_01433 or something like that, which is what they show up as on my phone - which is normal, but NOW they download to my PC as a sequential filename such as 1000007145 - something that makes no sense.

You can look at the Properties of the pics and those show the date/time taken, but it doesn't help me when I am trying to easily track pics taken by date/time.

Yes, I can manually change the filenames once I save them - which is a real PITA, but what changed? Is there some setting somewhere that got changed with an automatic update that I can't find?

How can I get back to having them download to my PC using the date/time stamp as filenames?

Any help is appreciated.

Fred
creator: fredman11

title: Text runs off right edge of screen when I compose
content:
When I compose a message in Thunderbird the text runs off the right edge of the screen. If I keep typing blind eventually the text will wrap but some text will still not be visible.

Is there a way to set Thunderbird to recognize the width of my monitor (slightly narrower than standard) or some other remedy?

After I finish I can zoom out and see what was hidden but of I type at that level of zoom the same thing will happen again.

Thanks.
creator: modemjunkie

title: Cannot Retreive Outlook Email
content:
Receiving the following message. Changed nothing. Just stopped working. All other portable devices working fine.

The RETR command did not succeed. Error retrieving a message. Mail server outlook.office365.com responded: Server Unavailable. 21

Has anyone seen this or have a solution? Thank you.
creator: arhaggard

title: combined inbox inThunderbird
content: I used to use Mailspring and loved it's combined inbox. Incoming messages for both of my email accounts would show in a combined inbox. I like Thunderbird and wish it had a combined inbox.Do we think it will ever happen?
